"Here Comes Goodbye" is the title of a song written by American Idol season 6 finalist Chris Sligh and Clint Lagerberg. It was recorded by the country pop group Rascal Flatts, who released it in January 2009 as their twenty-third single, and the first from their sixth album, Unstoppable. This song debuted at #29 on the Billboard Hot Country Songs charts dated for February 7, 2009 and became their tenth Number One on the chart dated April 25, 2009.

"Here Comes Goodbye" was written by Chris Sligh, a finalist on the sixth season of the talent competition American Idol, along with Clint Lagerberg. The song is a power ballad beginning with piano accompaniment. The lyric explains the male narrator's realization that his lover is about to leave him. However with the debut of the music video, the lyrics can be interpreted as a man who has died and is saying goodbye to his family, and watching his family say goodbye to him.

A string section and electric guitar accompaniment backs the song from the second verse onward, and an electric guitar solo precedes the bridge.

Rascal Flatts released "Here Comes Goodbye" to radio on January 20, 2009. It is the group's twenty-third single release overall, and the lead-off single to their sixth studio album, Unstoppable. The song debuted at #29 on the Billboard Hot Country Songs charts dated for February 7, 2009 and reached #1 on the chart dated April 25, 2009. To claim the top spot, "Here Comes Goodbye" jumped 6-1, the biggest climb to Number One since Taylor Swift sent "Our Song" 6-1 on the chart dated December 22, 2007. "Here Comes Goodbye" is also the group's tenth Number One.
